div.head: ¶ By the King.
❧ A Proclamation touching the Corporation of Sope-makers of London.
div.p: WHereas the Kings most Excellent Majestie for the better preuention and reformation of such falsities and deceits, as might be attempted and practised in the making of Sope within the Kingdome; And for the regulation of that Trade (so much co • cerning the publique) in a just and orderly way, Did by Letters Patents under the great Seal of England, bearing date the two and twentieth day of May last, (with the advice of His privie Councell) incorporate Edward Bromfield, then Lord Maior of the Citie of London, and divers other persons, Sope-makers of that Citie, by the name of Governour, Assistants, and Cominalty of the Society of Sope-makers of London; And hath thereby granted to them and their Successours, power and priviledge to make and sell all manner of Sope, and to make search and seisure in all places within the Realm of England, and Dominion of Wales, Port and Town of Barwick, aswell by land as by water, of all such Sope as shall be corruptly or unduely made, with Inhibition to all other persons whatsoever, to use or exercise the Art or Mystery of Sope-making, unlesse they shall be made free of, and allowed by the said Society.

And that His Majesties Subjects might not receive dammage in the goodnesse or prices of Sope; His Majestie by an Indenture of the same date made between His Majesty and the said Company, hath provided, That good and merchantable Sope of severall sorts, such as was heretofore generally used and well-liked of, shall be made by this Society, sufficient for the use and expence of the Kingdome, and by them sold at moderate prices (viz.) the Sope made with Whale-oyle, and other merchantable Oyle and Materials, at three pence halfpeny the pound, and the Sope made with Oyl-Olive, Rape Oyle, and other Materials being of the best Crown-Sope, at four pence halfpeny the pound, by the Barrell, half Barrell, Firkin, or half Firkin, and not above, nor at any greater rates or values.

To the intent therefore, That all His Majesties loving Subjects may take notice of His Majesties Princely care in the ordering of the making and vending of Sope in such a way, as may be without deceit to His Majesties people; His Majestie doth hereby straightly charge and command, that no person or persons, of what quality or condition soever, other then such as are or shall be free of, or allowed by the said Societie, do from henceforth presume to use or exercise the Art or Mystery of Sope-making, or to make any manner of Sope whatsoever, to sell or put to sale within the Realm of England, Dominion of Wales, or Town of Barwick,
or to make, prepare, or draw, or suffer to be made, prepared, or drawen within their private houses, or in any other place or places whatsoever, any Lees for the making of any kind of Sope whatsoever to be put to sale, nor buy, utter, or put to sale any Sope, but such as shall be made under the rule, government or allowance of the said Societie, upon pain to forfeit to His Majestie the same Sope and Lees, so made, drawen, bought, or sold, in whose hands soever they shall be found, and also under pain of His Majesties high displeasure, and such punishments as shall be thought meet to be inflicted in that behalf.

And His Majestie doth hereby straightly charge and command, that no person or persons, His Majesties naturall born Subjects, Denizens, or Strangers, Merchants, Artificers, or others whatsoever, do hereafter import or bring, or cause to be imported or brought into the realm of England, dominion of Wales, or towne of Barwick, from His Majesties kingdomes of Scotland or Ireland, or from any forreigne parts beyond the seas, any hard Sope, or soft Sope, or other sort of Sope whatsoever, to be used, sold or put to sale here; upon pain of forfeiture to His Majestie of all such Sope so to be imported, and such further penalties and punishments as shall be meet to be inflicted upon the contemners of his Royall command.

And His Majestie doth hereby declare His Royall wil and pleasure to be, and doth straightly charge and command that no person or persons whatsoever, either His Majesties naturall born Subjects, Denizens, or Strangers, Merchants, Artificers, or any others, do hereafter import or bring, or cause to be imported or brought from any forraine parts beyond the seas, any Potashes into any Port, Creek or place within the realme of England, dominion of Wales, or towne of Barwick, but only into the Port of London, there to be sold by the importers thereof to the said Societie of Sopemakers of London, and to none other person or persons whatsoever, except the Importers or such as they shall sell them unto, shall give good caution to His Majesties Customers to export and vend the same in forraigne parts beyond the seas; Saving alwayes that if any ship shall arrive at the Port of Hull (from whence there is much Trade to the East countreys) being laden aswell with other Merchandizes as with Potashes, it may be lawfull to land the Potashes there, leaving them deposited in His Majesties Storehouse, untill they may be shipped for London, or for forraigne parts in some other ship.

And His Majestie doth likewise declare His royall will and pleasure to be, That no Potashes whatsoever, made or to be made, within the realme of England, or dominion of Wales, shall be sold or disposed of to any person or persons whatsoever, but to the said Societie, except the makers thereof, or such as they shall sell or dispose the same unto, shall give caution to His Majesties said Customers for the exportation and vending the same beyond the seas; upon pain of forfeiture of all such Potashes as shall be imported, sold or disposed of contrary to His Majesties Royall command herein declared, and upon such further punishments and penalties as shall be meet to be inflicted upon the offenders herein. And to the end also that the Sope made by the said Company, may not be sold by retail or in grosse, from the places where the same is or shall be made, at any excessive prices, but at such indifferent and moderate rates, as may be convenient betwixt the buyer and seller; His Majesties will and pleasure is, and he doth hereby straightly charge and command, that the Major, Bayliffe or other chief Officer in every Citie, Burrough, and towne corporate within his said realm and dominion, with the assistance of two of the next Iustices of the Peace of that County, or the two next adjoyning Iustices of the Peace where the retailers or sellers of such Sope shall dwel out of any Citie or town Corporate, or where such Sope shall be sold, upon any complaint that shall be made of any excessive prices, do limit and set such rates upon all Sope that shall be either retailed or sold in grosse, from the places where the same was or shall be made, as they in their judgements shall think reasonable, consideration being by them had aswell of the setled prices paid to the said Societie, as of the charges of tarriage, sea adventure, and other charges and casualties thereunto belonging, with fit and competent gains to the seller. And for the better performance and execution of His Majesties pleasure touching the premisses, His Majestie doth hereby authorize, require and command the said governour, assistants, and comminaltie of the Society of Sope-makers of London, that from time to time by themselves or by their agents, officers, and servants, they cause diligent search and enquirie to be made in all or any place or places whatsoever, aswell within Liberties as without, for all or any Sope of what kinde soever, that is, hath, or shall be made, sold, or vented, as also for all or any Lees made, prepared or drawen, or which shall be made, prepared, or drawen by
any person or persons whatsoever, not under the rule and government of the said Societie, or by licence or allowance of the same; And also for all or any Potashes imported or sold, contrary to His Majesties pleasure herein declared; And all such Sope which shall be so made, and all Lees and other Materials (as Oil, Tallow, and Potashes prepared for the making of such Sope) And all Potashes which shall be imported, put to sale, or disposed of, contrary to the tenour hereof, to take, seize and carry away to His Majesties use. And for the better discovery of all the said offences and offenders therein, His Maiestie doth hereby authorize the said governour, assistants, and comminaltie of the said Societie, and their deputies, officers, ministers, and servants, with the assistance of a Constable, or any other lawfull officer, to enter into any houses, cellers, shops, or other places whatsoever, and also into any ships, barks, or other vessels, and there to search for, seize, take and carry away all such Sope as shall be found to have been unduely made by any person or persons not being under the rule, government or allowance of the said Societie; And all Lees, Oyl, Tallow, Potashes, and other Materials, drawen or prepared for the making of Sope, and all Potashes, either forreigne or home made, imported, put to sale, or disposed of contrary to His Majesties pleasure herein declared. And His Majestie doth hereby straightly charge and command, that all fats, pannes, and vessels, made, erected or set up, or that shall be made, set up, or imployed for the making or boyling of Sope, And all tubs, pannes, cisternes, and other vessels for drawing or preparing of Lees, contrary to His Majesties Letters Patents granted to the said Company, and His Royall pleasure herein expressed, shall by the said Societie of Sope-makers of London, their deputies or assignes (whom His Majestie doth in that behalf hereby authorize) by and with the assistance of a Constable or other lawfull officer, be pulled up, defaced, and made unserviceable; And that the persons offending therein be further proceeded against, and punished as shall be meet for such their contempts.

And His Majesty doth further straitly charge and command, that no person or persons whatsoever do at any time hereafter presume to withstand or oppose the said Companies Searchers or their deputies, Agents or Servants in searching for Sope corruptly, or unduly made or imported, or for Potashes imported, or put to sale contrary to the tenor hereof, or for, or in seizing or taking away thereof, or of any Lees, Oyl, Tallow, Potashes, or other Materials prepared for the making of such Sope, or in the custody of undue makers of Sope, or undue sellers of Potashes, or in the defacing of Fats, Pans, or Vessels erected or to be erected or used contrary to His Majesties said Letters Patents, or otherwise in the due execution of their said Office.

And His Majesties will and pleasure is, and He doth hereby charge and command all and singuler the Officers of His Customes within all and every the Ports and Havens of His said Kingdome of England, and Dominion of Wales, and Town of Barwick, and the Creeks and members thereof, And also within His Majesties Cinque Ports, and the members thereof, That they and euery of them do not onely forbeare to take any Entry or Entries, or give any Bill or Warrant for unlading or lading of any Sope prohibited as aforesaid, either by the name of Sope, or by or under any other name or title whatsoever, or of any Potashes which shall be imported contrary to the tenor hereof, but do also cause seizure and stay to be made thereof to His Majesties use, and within ten dayes after such seizure and stay so made, to give notice of the same from time to time to the Governour of the said Society, or his deputy for the time being, and afterwards upon demand to make delivery thereof to the said Governour or his deputie for the time being, or to their Assignes, upon pain of His Majesties high displeasure, and such other punishments, as their contempts, or neglects herein shall be found to deserve. And whereas divers persons of mean and needy condition are imployed in the making of Sope, and drawing of Lees, by persons of better abilitie and estate, not under the rule and government of the said Societie, His Majestie doth therefore hereby further declare, That the Owners, Lessees, and Inhabitants of all and every such house and houses, wherein any such Sope shall be made, or Lees drawen or prepared by any person or persons whatsoever, not by, and under the rule and government of the said Societie, aswell as the Owners of such Sope and Lees, and such as by, or with their moneys, stock, materials, or otherwise, imploy or set them to work, shall be proceeded against as contemners of His Majesties royall commands.

And whereas His Majestie did heretofore Incorporate divers persons into one body politique by the name of Governour, Assistants, and Fellows of the Societie of Sopers of Westminster, and did enable them with sundry powers and priviledges, for the making and vending of Sope within the Realm, Which Grant (being afterwards strengthened, aswell with sundry His Majesties Proclamations, as by Decrees and Orders of His high Court of Star-Chamber and otherwise) the said Societie of Sopers, have sithence resigned and surrendred up into His Majesties hands, who hath cancelled and vacated the same; And His Majesties pleasure is, that all His Subjects should take knowledge thereof, And that all Proclamations, Orders, and Decrees touching the said late Societie of Sopers of Westminster, are no longer to be in force, or put in execution, but are by His Majestie repealed and determined, and hereby declared so to be to all intents and purposes whatsoever.

And His Majestie doth likewise straightly charge and command all Iustices of Peace, Maiors, Sheriffs, Bayliffs, Constables, Headboroughs, Tithingmen, and all other His Majesties Officers and Ministers, and also His Majesties Officers, and Ministers of His Court of Admiralty, and Cinque Ports, and all others to whom it shall appertain, that they and every of them at all times hereafter, and from time to time without excuse or delay, be aiding and assisting to the said Society of Sope-makers of London, their Searchers and Deputies, and to all His Majesties Customers, Waiters, and all other person and persons in the due execution of all or any the premisses when they shall be thereunto required, as they will answer to the contrary at their perils.

Neverthelesse, His Majesties will and pleasure is, That neither Sir Richard Weston, Knight, nor the severall Sope-makers of Bristoll, Bridgewater, Exeter, Somerset, Dorset, Devon, and Cornwall, nor any of them respectively shall be restrained or impeached hereby in the making and vending of such sorts and proportions of Sope yearly, as they respectively are allowed to make and sell in the particular Counties and places to them respectively assigned.
div.closer:
Giuen at the Court at VVhitehall, the eight and twentieth day of December, in the thirteenth year of His Majesties Reigne.
❧ God save the King.
